Objects¶

PhysicalObject¶

class pyroborobo.PhysicalObject¶

Abstract Base Class for all roborobo physical objects.

A Physical object is a element in the roborobo simulator with a shape, it can move, disappear, and impact other objects or robots. Objects have several callbacks that are called by roborobo.

Objects, once created, always exist in the roborobo simulator. Robots and other objects can interact with them if the objects are registered. When an object is registered, that means that the simulator takes its physics into account.

Being registered is different from being visible. An object can be made visible (to the human) using the show() method, or invisible using the hide(). If an object is visible and unregistered, it will be visible to the humans but robot will not see them or collide with them. If an object is invisible and registered, the robots will see them and collide with them but the object will not be rendered on the window or screenshot.

You can force roborobo to display all registered elements using the X-ray mode. You can activate the x-ray mode by pressing x on your keyboard when roborobo is rendered in a GUI.

The step() method is called at each time step before the robots’ step method. The callback is_touched() is called when a robot has the object in sight, is_walked() is called when a robot walk on the “soft” surface of the object, and the method is_pushed() is called when a robot collide with the object.

PhysicalObject cannot be instantiated by itself, only its subclasses SquareObject and CircleObject and their subclasses can be created.

Read Object Creation for a tutorial on how to use Objects.

SquareObject¶

class pyroborobo.SquareObject(id: int, data: dict) → SquareObject¶

Physical object with an axis-aligned rectangular shape

Read Object Creation for a tutorial on how to use Objects.

Parameters
id: int

The id of the object

data: dict (optional)

The data for the object read from the properties file

See also

PhysicalObject

Reference for physical objects

Attributes
id

int: the id of the object

soft_height

int: the height of the soft part of the object (can be walked on) in pixel

soft_width

int: the width of the soft part of the object (can be walked on) in pixel

solid_height

int: the height of the solid part of the object in pixel

solid_width

int: the width of the solid part of the object in pixel

Methods

can_register(self)

Can the object be registered at its current location

hide(self)

hide the object from the screen (collision is still active)

is_pushed(self, id, force, float])

Callback when the object is pushed

is_touched(self, id)

Callback when the object is touched

is_walked(self, id)

Callback when the object is walked on

register(self)

Register the object (activate collision)

relocate(*args, **kwargs)

Overloaded function.

set_color(self, red, blue, green)

set the (r,g,b) color for the object

set_coordinates(self, x, y)

force the object to be at the (x,y) coordinates without checking

show(self)

show the object from the screen (collision is still inactive)

step(self)

Call at each timestep

unregister(self)

Unregister the object (deactivate collision)

y: int

Returns
